abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Small Scale Irrigation Project (SSI) in
            Colombia. The project's objectives were to: (a)
            increase agricultural productivity and cropping intensity
            and therefore rural incomes of about 43,000 small-scale
            farmers; (b) reduce market risks by smoothing out production
            throughout the year; (c) develop the technological base for
            the future development of La Mojana Region; (d) improve cost
            recovery from public sector investment in irrigation; and
            (e) strengthen community Participation. Although the
            Bank's performance was deficient during the early
            stages of project design and implementation, its'
            overall performance is considered satisfactory. Both the
            Government (Borrower) and INAT (Implementing Agency)
            performed deficiently, though both should be recognized for
            positive contributions. The key lessons learned from the
            project are as follows: (a) Bank support for the work of a
            dedicated group within an organization which has many
            weaknesses can lead to some success; (b) Borrower ownership
            and commitment is fundamental for effective implementation
            and sustainability; (c) SSI projects require a high level of
            attention to technical, economic, institutional and social
            issues in addition to engineering; (d) an engineering-minded
            irrigation agency with a narrow mandate and limited
            experience in agricultural matters is unlikely to have
            sufficient capacity to ensure that on-farm development
            activities are adequately carried out; and e) greater
            involvement of Water User Associations and the regional
            irrigation offices in all stages of project implementation
            should be reinforced in order to improve project impact.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Small Scale Irrigation Project will
            build upon and expand the Small Scale Irrigation Pilot
            Programme established under the Irrigation Rehabilitation II
            project and the Government's own program initiated in
            the mid-1980s. The project will provide supplementary
            irrigation for about 43,000 farmers over a six-year period
            by establishing about 850 small irrigation schemes. The
            project will consist of the following components: a)
            off-farm irrigation infrastructure; b) on-farm investments
            c) technology transfer; d) institutional development; e)
            environmental protection and f) La Mojana Pilot project (
            for pilot agricultural development in a large but
            environmentally fragile drainage area of great economic
            potential )
